column1: Mölndal is located on the western main line railway between Gothenburg and Malmö and the European highways E6/E20 run through the area from north to south. Mölndal is served by the Gothenburg tramway system.
The name of the city derives from two words; Möln
column2: which is a short form for Möllor
column5: which is the Swedish word for valley. Mölndal is the "Valley of mills". The narrow but high and long waterfalls in Kvarnbyn gave the necessary power to all the watermills that together with the windmills on the hills gave birth to the early industrialisation of Mölndal.

column1: Mölndal is best known for its high concentration of companies in life sciences. AstraZeneca has one of its global research centres here with more than 3
column2: 100 employees. Several other companies in areas of research such as pharmaceuticals
column4: and biotechnology are also located here. The proximity to the University of Gothenburg and to Chalmers University of Technology - with their technology parks - has supported development of other sectors
column5: such as microwave technology and information technology. Two national research institutes
column6: IFP SICOMP AB and IVF Industrial Research and Development Corporation
